Method Detail

getNextReply

public Message getNextReply(MessageID repliableMessageID)
                     throws ReplyTimeoutException
Description copied from interface: DispatchingService
It returns the next reply available for the given message. If no reply is available, it suspends until a reply arrive. If the reply timeout expires while suspended it throws a TimeoutException.
If the repliableMessageID is not present it returns null. This may happen if a repliable message with the given identifier has never been sent or if all the replies have already been been got.

Example:

Message r = null;
try{
do{
r = getNextReply(MessageID);
}while(r != null); }catch(TimeoutException e){
System.out.println("Error: Some recipient did not sent their reply or some reply got lost"); }

Specified by:
getNextReply in interface DispatchingService
Parameters:
repliableMessageID - ID of the corresponding repliable message.
Returns:
first reply if present else null.
Throws:
ReplyTimeoutException
See Also:
DispatchingService.hasMoreReplies(MessageID)

hasMoreReplies

public boolean hasMoreReplies(MessageID repliableMessageID)
Description copied from interface: DispatchingService
Can be used for checking whether there is a reply in the queue for the specific repliable message. If repliableMessageID is not present it returns false.

Specified by:
hasMoreReplies in interface DispatchingService
Parameters:
repliableMessageID - ID of the repliable message.
Returns:
TRUE iff there is a reply in the queue.

getAllReplies

public Replies getAllReplies(MessageID repliableMessageID)
Description copied from interface: DispatchingService
Return all the replies for a specific repliable message. It waits until all the replies arrived or timeout expires.

Specified by:
getAllReplies in interface DispatchingService
Parameters:
repliableMessageID - ID of the repliable message.
Returns:
all the replies in the queue.

getNextMessage

public Message getNextMessage()
Description copied from interface: DispatchingService
Get the first message available and removes it from the queue of received messages. If there are no messages available suspends the caller until a new message arrives.

Specified by:
getNextMessage in interface DispatchingService
Returns:
first message available.

getNextMessage

public Message getNextMessage(long timeout)
Description copied from interface: DispatchingService
Get the first message available and removes it from the queue of received messages. If there are no messages available suspends the caller until a new message arrives or timeout expires. If this event happens, it returns null, else, it returns the first message available.

Specified by:
getNextMessage in interface DispatchingService
Parameters:
timeout - how long it will wait for a message to arrive.
Returns:
first message available.

getNextMessage

public Message getNextMessage(Filter f)
Description copied from interface: DispatchingService
Get the first message available that matches the specified filter and removes it from the queue of received messages. If there are no messages available suspends the caller until a new message arrives.

Specified by:
getNextMessage in interface DispatchingService
Parameters:
f - the Filter used to select the messages
Returns:
the first message available that matches the filter f

Description copied from interface: DispatchingService
Check whether there are messages available.

Specified by:
hasMoreMessages in interface DispatchingService
Returns:
true if there is at least one message available, false otherwise.

notifyNeighborAdded

public void notifyNeighborAdded(NodeDescriptor addedNeighbor,
                                java.io.Serializable reconfInfo)
Description copied from interface: NeighborhoodChangeListener
This method is called whenever a new neighbor connects (or is connected).

Specified by:
notifyNeighborAdded in interface NeighborhoodChangeListener
Parameters:
addedNeighbor - The NodeDescriptor of the added neighbor.
reconfInfo - additional information about the topology change.
The Reconfigurator can use this information to optimize the reconfiguration process. The actual information contained in the parameter depends on the combination of topology manager and reconfigurator in use.
This parameter can be null if the topology manager does not support providing additional information, or there is no information to provide.

notifyNeighborDead

public void notifyNeighborDead(NodeDescriptor deadNeighbor,
                               java.io.Serializable reconfInfo)
Description copied from interface: NeighborhoodChangeListener
This method is called whenever a neighbor of the local node dies.

Specified by:
notifyNeighborDead in interface NeighborhoodChangeListener
Parameters:
deadNeighbor - The NodeDescriptor of the no more reachable neighbor.
reconfInfo - additional information about the topology change.
The Reconfigurator can use this information to optimize the reconfiguration process. The actual information contained in the parameter depends on the combination of topology manager and reconfigurator in use.
This parameter can be null if the topology manager does not support providing additional information, or there is no information to provide.

publish

public void publish(Message msg)
Description copied from interface: DispatchingService
Publish a new message. At the moment of publication, each message id given a new unique id using the MessageID class.
If msg is instance of Repliable it will wait for replies.

Specified by:
publish in interface DispatchingService
Parameters:
msg - the Message to publish.

reply

                  MessageID repliableMessageID)
Description copied from interface: DispatchingService
Send a reply. The reply message is given a new unique MessageID.

Specified by:
reply in interface DispatchingService
Parameters:
reply - reply to send.
repliableMessageID - ID of the message to which it replies.
